subject: linear_algebra
title: Abstract Vector Spaces
contentHtml:
A vector space is a set of vectors with operations that satisfy certain properties.

These properties are known as axioms and ensure that the operations behave in a consistent manner.
name: Vector Space Axioms" },
intuition: Think of a vector space as a set of arrows in a coordinate system. The axioms ensure that the operations on these arrows behave consistently, allowing us to perform calculations and transformations.
realWorldApplications: Machine learning models can be represented as vectors in a high-dimensional space, enabling techniques like dimensionality reduction and clustering.
commonMistakes: Confusing vector spaces with geometric spaces

subject: linear_algebra
title: Abstract Vector Spaces
contentHtml:
A vector space is a set of vectors that can be added and scaled in a way that satisfies certain properties.

These properties are known as axioms, which ensure that the operations behave consistently and allow us to perform calculations with vectors.
intuition: Think of a vector space as a set of arrows that can be combined and scaled in a way that makes sense.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, vectors are used to represent data points or features. Vector spaces provide a framework for combining and transforming these representations.
commonMistakes: Don't confuse vector spaces with geometric spaces like Euclidean space R^n.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Abstract Vector Spaces
contentHtml:
A vector space is a fundamental concept in linear algebra that extends our understanding of vectors beyond just Euclidean spaces like Rⁿ.

Formally, an abstract vector space V over a field F is a set equipped with two operations: addition (+) and scalar multiplication (⋅).
name: Abstract Vector Space" },
intuition: Think of an abstract vector space as a 'vector factory' that can produce vectors with different structures. This allows us to generalize many linear algebra concepts and apply them to various domains.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, abstract vector spaces are used in feature engineering to transform data into more suitable representations for algorithms.
commonMistakes: Don't confuse abstract vector spaces with concrete ones like Rⁿ. The key difference is the lack of a specific underlying geometry.
